people.name: Joseph Austerweil
people.title: Assistant Professor
people.blurb: As a computational cognitive psychologist, my research program explores questions at the intersection of perception and higher-level cognition. I use recent advances in statistics and computer science to formulate ideal learner models to see how they solve these problems and then test the model predictions using traditional behavioral experimentation. Ideal learner models help us understand the knowledge people use to solve problems because such knowledge must be made explicit for the ideal learner model to successfully produce human behavior. This method yields novel machine learning methods and leads to the discovery of new psychological principles.

people.name: Jeff Zemla
people.title: Assistant Scientist
people.blurb: Jeff studies semantic memory and Alzheimer's Disease. He received his PhD from Rice University working with Mike Byrne.

people.name: Nicole Beckage
people.title: Assistant Scientist
people.blurb: Dr. Beckage is currently researching models of cognitive and information search on multiplex networks.

people.name: Shi Xian Liew
people.title: Postdoctoral Researcher
people.blurb: Xian recently graduated from University of Melbourne where he worked with Dr. Little and Dr. Howe. He investigates computational models of categorization.

people.name: Kendra Lange
people.title: Undergraduate Researcher
people.blurb: Kendra examines the interrelation between bilingualism, creativity, and intelligence. Specifically, she is examining whether reported advantages in creativity and intelligence due to bilngualism can be explained by properties of their representations.

people.name: Jacqueline Erens
people.title: Undergraduate Researcher
people.blurb: Jackie has examined how people reason with features and relations using the Bayesian Generalization Framework in the domain of emojis. She is now exploring ambiguity in language production.

people.name: Sichao Yang
people.title: Undergraduate Researcher
people.blurb: Sichao is an undergraduate at UW-Madison focusing on Psych, Math and Comp Sci. Before transferring to UW, he studied motion planning and computer vision for UAVs at Beihang University and NELVT, Peking University. Now he is interested in computational models of working memory and commonsense reasoning.

people.name: Anantha (Van) Rao
people.title: Undergraduate Researcher
people.blurb: Van is interested in how people perceive, reason, and make judgments about time.

people.name: Elizabeth Pettit
people.title: Post-Baccularate Researcher
people.blurb: Elizabeth graduated from UW-Madison in the Spring of 2017, majoring in Psychology. She will be a PhD graduate program in Psychology at Miami University starting September 2018.

people.name: Elise Hopman
people.title: Psychology Graduate Student at University of Wisconsin-Madison
people.blurb: Elise is interested in how language learning works and investigates this question with behavioral as well as computational research.

people.name: Yun-Shiuan (Sean) Chang
people.title: Visiting graduate student
people.blurb: Sean recently graduated from National Taiwan University with BS in psychology and neuroscience.  He currently investigates children's math cognition development via computational modeling with fMRI data.

people.name: Jie Ren
people.title: Visiting Instructor, Brown University; Visiting Professor, McGovern Institute for Brain Research at Beijing Normal University
people.blurb: ​Jie's​ research is concerned with the biology and neurology of infant speech ​learning​. The research methods used in ​her​ research include behavioral measures of infant speech perception, functional neuroimaging (fNIRS) and computational modeling with ​machine-learning techniques.

people.name: Boyoung Kim
people.title: Graduate Student at Brown University
people.blurb: Boyoung collaborates on modeling how people learn social norms..

people.name: Babak Hemmatian
people.title: Graduate Student at Brown University
people.blurb: I am a Ph.D. student of cognitive science, with a background in psychology, but a new-found love for computational modeling. I am most interested in integrating the computational models offered for different kinds of reasoning (inductive, causal, deductive, etc.), offering new such models (with an emphasis on causal reasoning) and comparing the proposals with regards to how well they capture the qualitative and quantitative aspects of human reasoning.

people.name: Mark Ho
people.title: Former Graduate Student
people.blurb: Mark completed his PhD in December 2017. He is now a postdoctoral researcher with Tom Griffiths and Sanjit Seshia.

people.name: Nolan Conaway
people.title: Former Postdoctoral Researcher
people.blurb: Nolan now works as a data scientist at Shutterstock.

people.name: Ting Qian
people.title: Former Postdoctoral Scholar
people.blurb: Ting is now a data scientist at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia.

people.name: Yoed Kenett
people.title: Former Postdoctoral Scholar
people.blurb: Yoed is now a postdoctoral scholar with Sharon Thompson-Schill at University of Pennsylvania.

people.name: Mowafak Allaham
people.title: Former Post-Undergrad Research Assistant
people.blurb: Mowafak is now a graduate student in Psychology at University of Illinois-Chicago. He works with Sylvia Morelli.
